title: FTC may sanction Zuckerberg for Facebook privacy woes: report
text: Federal regulators are considering holding Facebook Inc.  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg accountable for the company's handling of users' personal data, the Washington Port reported late Thursday.

title: Earnings season is ramping up and these could be the big winners: Facebook
text: Next week is the biggest week form earnings. Should investors fade or trade into earnings.

title: Facebook now says ‘millions’ of Instagram passwords were exposed internally
text: Facebook Inc. said Thursday that a security incident that exposed Instagram passwords internally was significantly worse than first thought.

title: Facebook's Stock May Surge Following First Quarter Results
text: Facebook stock may surge to as high $196 following results.

title: Facebook says its employees had access to millions of Instagram passwords
text: The company originally said in March that thousands of Instagram passwords were exposed, but updated that figure Thursday.

title: Three Stocks the World's Best Investors Are Buying Now.
text: Many investors keep an eye on the additions and subtractions that billionaire hedge fund managers make.

title: Facebook (FB) Q1 Earnings to Gain on Ad & Stories Momentum
text: Facebook's (FB) first-quarter 2019 results are likely to gain on continued subscriber growth, driven by rapid adoption of Instagram and WhatsApp Stories.

title: Facebook says it inadvertently uploaded 1.5 million users' email contacts without permission
text: Facebook said on Wednesday evening it may have "unintentionally uploaded" the email contacts of up to 1.5 million users on its site, without their permission or knowledge, when they signed up for new accounts since May 2016.

title: Facebook 'unintentionally uploaded' email contacts of 1.5 million users: report
text: Facebook had "unintentionally uploaded" email contacts of 1.5 million new users since March 2016, Reuters reported late Wednesday, citing company confirmation in its report.

title: Facebook says it 'unintentionally uploaded' 1.5 million users' email contacts without permission
text: The reported incident is the latest in a long list of privacy concerns and controversies saddling the tech giant, which is facing increased government scrutiny.
